description: spoke +â€Ž -y, from the resemblance to spokes of a wheel.

adjectives.description: spoky (comparative more spoky, superlative most spoky)

entries.meaning: Of a roll of film: incorrectly wound, resulting in humps that appear as radial lines.
examples: A spoky roll is shown beside a smooth roll in Figure 1. Spokiness occurs both with 35mm and with 16mm film but does not appear to cause projection difficulties with 35mm film.
